久仰.definition: honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you.; It's an honor to meet you at last.

久仰大名.definition: I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)

久假不歸.definition: to fail to return a borrowed item

久別重逢.definition: to meet again after a long period of separation

久已.definition: long ago; a long time since

久慕.definition: lit. I've admired you for a long time (honorific).; I've been looking forward to meeting you.; It's an honor to meet you at last.

久攻不下.definition: to attack for a long time without success

久曠.definition: to leave uncultivated for a long time; by extension, to neglect one's work; to remain single

久治.definition: Jigzhi or Jiuzhi county (Tibetan: gcig sgril rdzong) in Golog Tibetan autonomous prefecture 果洛州[Guo3 luo4 zhou1], Qinghai (formerly in Sichuan)

久治縣.definition: Jigzhi or Jiuzhi county (Tibetan: gcig sgril rdzong) in Golog Tibetan autonomous prefecture 果洛州[Guo3 luo4 zhou1], Qinghai (formerly in Sichuan)

久留.definition: to stay for a long time

久病成良醫.definition: long illness makes the patient into a good doctor (idiom)

久病成醫.definition: (proverb) a long illness makes the patient into a doctor

久等.definition: to wait for a long time

久經.definition: to have long experience of; to go through repeatedly

久經考驗.definition: well tested over a long period of time (idiom); seasoned

久而久之.definition: over time; as time passes; in the fullness of time

久聞大名.definition: your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)

久負盛名.definition: seasoned; honed to perfection over centuries; special reserve

久違.definition: (haven't done sth) for a long time; a long time since we last met
